text:
Former Vol Kamara makes Super Bowl pick on 'The Nation' Former Vols star Alvin Kamara predicts his hometown Falcons to win Super Bowl --- kind of 
Alvin Kamara made his Super Bowl prediction Sunday afternoon on ‘The Nation.’ 
Well, kind of. 
Tennessee’s former standout tailback, who said he’s preparing for the upcoming NFL Combine in Indianapolis, initially picked the underdog Atlanta Falcons. 
“I’m from Atlanta, so I gotta go with the Falcons,” Kamara told Chris Low and John Brice on the statewide syndicated show, “but I don’t ever bet against Tom Brady . We’ll see how the game goes.” 
(What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) As for the former Volunteers All-SEC star, who declared for the NFL Draft immediately on the heels of Tennessee’s Franklin American Mortgage Music City Bowl win in late-December, he said he’s been dialed in on his own NFL preparations. 
“I’ve been wrapping up the season and trying to decide, making that jump, declaring for the Draft,” said Kamara, who shined in just two years on Rocky Top after beginning his career at Alabama and spending time in junior college. “It was kind of nerve-wracking, going into training, it’s getting closer and closer to the Combine. This is what I’ve been, what, 21 years, 15 to 16 years playing football all for this moment. It’s been a good time so far training. I’m just doing what I’ve got to do to prepare myself. 
“With me, I think it’s really just staying the course and believing [advice for others]. It’s easy to get discouraged [after the way Kamara’s career started at ‘Bama], you might not be playing as much as you want to or progressing or excelling, but for me having a great support system, that’s one thing that got me through. 
“That’s the advice I would give.” Author
